DOC.brief_summary: People who are overweight and/or obese usually are insulin resistant and so are at risk of type 2 diabetes. However, research has shown that some overweight and/or obese people remain insulin sensitive and healthy despite their weight. The investigators hypothesise that insulin-sensitive overweight and/or obese people maintain their insulin sensitivity and metabolic health over time. The investigators also hypothesise that the preservation of insulin sensitivity will be determined by key metabolic factors.
DOC.brief_title: Insulin-sensitive Obesity: Lessons From Longitudinal Data
DOC.criteria: Participation in the previous SiDIRAD (1) or EXCESS (26) study. Willingness to give written informed consent and willingness to participate in and comply with the study. Pregnant and/or lactating women.
